paragraphs.text: Principia Cybernetica is an international cooperation of scientists in the field of cybernetics and systems science, especially known for their website, Principia Cybernetica. They have dedicated their organization to what they call "a computer-supported evolutionary-systemic philosophy, in the context of the transdisciplinary academic fields of Systems Science and Cybernetics".[1]

paragraphs.title: Organisation
paragraphs.text:
Principia Cybernetica was initiated in 1989 in the USA by Cliff Joslyn and Valentin Turchin, and a year later broadened to Europe with Francis Heylighen from Belgium joining their cooperation.

The organization is associated with:

paragraphs.title: Principia Cybernetica Web
paragraphs.text:
The Principia Cybernetica Web,[4] which went online in 1993, is one of the first complex webs in the world.
It is still viewed as one of the most important sites[by whom?] on cybernetics, systems theory, complexity, and related approaches.

paragraphs.title: Workshops and symposia
paragraphs.text: Especially in the 1990s the Principia Cybernetica has organized a series of workshops and international symposia on cybernetic themes.[5] On the 1st Principia Cybernetica Workshop in June 1991 in Brussels many cyberneticists attended like Harry Bronitz, Gordon Pask, J.L. Elohim, Robert Glueck, Ranulph Glanville, Annemie Van Kerkhoven, Don McNeil, Elan Moritz, Cliff Joslyn, A. Comhaire and Valentin Turchin.[5]
